piece.name: Rue de Paris, temps de pluie (Paris Street; Rainy Day)
piece.description: The painting is currently displayed at the Art Institute of Chicago and shows the parisian streets Rue de Turin and Rue de Moscou on a cloudy, rainy day. While the scene might seem random at first, Caillebotte planned the painting with multiple sketches. The lantern divides the picture in two halves which each have one individual vanishing point. While the painting technique is not typical impressionistic one, the everyday motif and the playful perspective is.
